The 4-methoxyphenyl group also raises the melting point, due to additional dipole-dipole interactions by the methoxy group, estimated at around +30°C. The carbonyl group (C=O) in the propenone structure is a polar functional group which can increase the melting point by around +50°C because of its capacity for strong dipole-dipole interactions and potential hydrogen bonding. Lastly, the conjugation in the alkenone (propenone) backbone typically increases molecular rigidity, which can contribute an additional +10°C to the melting point. Summing these individual contributions: 5.5 (benzene base) + 40 (chlorophenyl) + 30 (methoxyphenyl) + 50 (carbonyl) + 10 (conjugation) gives a predicted total increase.
